alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 2:22PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Snow Through Tonight... A mix of Rain and snow has transitioned to snow across most areas this morning and will continue to snow through tonight. Most valley locations will get an inch or two of snow accumulation. Between 2 and 4 inches of snow is expected above 2000 ft by tonight, with areas in the Brooks Range getting up to 6 inches. Areas of the Alaska Range could see 6 or or more inches above 3000 ft. Northwest of 15 mph gusting to 35 mph is anticipated to develop through the late afternoon and continue into early tomorrow morning. This will cause blowing snow with reduced visibility over highway summits this afternoon into tonight.
